intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to modify a build configuration for an RCP application and export a RCP application product using PDE.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in development perspective
item.description:
To open the plug-in development perspective, select Window->Open Perspective->Other... and choose Plug-in Development.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Open the build configuration editor
item.description:
To open the build configuration editor, expand the com.example.rcpapp tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the build.properties file.
Select the Build tab to display the Build Configuration page if it is not the initial page.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Modify the build configuration
item.description:
In order to control what files are deployed with our packaged RCP application, we need to modify the build configuration.
To modify the build configuration, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the checkbox corresponding to the "icons" directory under the "Binary Build" heading
Select the checkbox corresponding to the "splash.bmp" file under the "Binary Build" heading

item.title: Open the product editor
item.description:
To open the product editor (if it is not already open), expand the com.example.rcpapp tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the rcpapp.product file.
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Export the plug-in based product
item.description: To export the product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Overview" tab within the product editor to display the "Overview" page
Click the "Eclipse Product export wizard" hyper-text link under the "Exporting" heading to launch the "Export" dialog box
Input "rcpapp_plugin-based" in the "Root directory" text box contained in the "Product Configuration" group
Input a destination directory in the "Directory" text box under the "Destination" group (e.g. "C:\" for Windows)

item.title: Browse the exported plug-in based product directory
item.description: To browse the exported product directory, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Navigate your file system to the destination directory specified in the previous step (e.g. "C:\" for Windows)
Note the presence of the "rcpapp_plugin-based" directory in the destination directory and open it
Note the presence of the "com.example.rcpapp" plug-in along with many other RCP plug-ins it depends upon within the "plugins" sub-directory
Note the "rcpapp" launcher with a branded icon ("rcpapp.exe" on Windows)
Marvel at your glorious plug-in based RCP application that is fully executable outside the Eclipse workspace
